definitions.text: (physics) electromagnetic radiation that can produce a visual sensation
examples: the light was filtered through a soft glass window

definitions.text: any device serving as a source of illumination
examples: he stopped the car and turned off the lights

definitions.text: a particular perspective or aspect of a situation
examples: although he saw it in a different light, he still did not understand

definitions.text: the quality of being luminous; emitting or reflecting light
examples: its luminosity is measured relative to that of our sun

definitions.text: an illuminated area
a condition of spiritual awareness; divine illumination
the visual effect of illumination on objects or scenes as created in pictures
examples: he could paint the lightest light and the darkest dark

definitions.text: a person regarded very fondly
having abundant light or illumination
examples: they played as long as it was light
as long as the lighting was good

definitions.text: mental understanding as an enlightening experience
examples: can you shed light on this problem?

definitions.text: merriment expressed by a brightness or gleam or animation of countenance
examples: he had a sparkle in his eye
there's a perpetual twinkle in his eyes

definitions.text: public awareness
examples: it brought the scandal to light

definitions.text: a divine presence believed by Quakers to enlighten and guide the soul
a visual warning signal
examples: they saw the light of the beacon
there was a light at every corner

definitions.text: a device for lighting or igniting fuel or charges or fires
make lighter or brighter

definitions.text: begin to smoke
examples: After the meal, some of the diners lit up

definitions.text: to come to rest, settle
cause to start burning; subject to fire or great heat

definitions.text: fall to somebody by assignment or lot
examples: It fell to me to notify the parents of the victims

definitions.text: alight from (a horse)

definitions.text: (used of color) having a relatively small amount of coloring agent

definitions.text: (used of vowels or syllables) pronounced with little or no stress

definitions.text: easily assimilated in the alimentary canal; not rich or heavily seasoned

definitions.text: moving easily and quickly; nimble

definitions.text: demanding little effort; not burdensome

definitions.text: (physics, chemistry) not having atomic weight greater than average
weak and likely to lose consciousness
examples: suddenly felt faint from the pain
was sick and faint from hunger

definitions.text: very thin and insubstantial
marked by temperance in indulgence
examples: abstemious with the use of adverbs

definitions.text: less than the correct or legal or full amount often deliberately so
having little importance
examples: losing his job was no light matter

definitions.text: intended primarily as entertainment; not serious or profound
silly or trivial
designed for ease of movement or to carry little weight
having relatively few calories
(of sleep) easily disturbed

definitions.text: with few burdens
